transcript.text: one more question I've been meaning to
ask you this what piece of advice you
remember until today that has made the
most impact in your life not advice
events or events which I remember very
well and had a big impact on my life
1945 August 6th that was the moment when
we learned if we wanted to learn that
human intelligence has achieved the
level where it would soon be capable of
destroying everything and I learned two
lessons on that day one was what had
just happened the second was nobody
cared I happened to be at a summer camp
the news of the Hiroshima bombing was
announced in the morning over the camp
loudspeaker people listened everybody
went on to their morning activity
swimming baseball game whatever it is
nobody cared when I got back to the city
I saw also who cares well those are two
lessons that are hard to forget and they
apply today
